climbs.name: The Wolf Man
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Alan Bartlett, Brandt Allen, Mike Wilson & Tom Atherton, 6/90

content.description: This steep grainy face is really good.  Pretty sustained to the fourth bolt then jugs.  I fiddled a lame #5 orange Metolius tcu into the horizontal, but the move to clip the third bolt wasn't that bad.
content.protection:
4 bolts, all 3/8" button heads that seem good, the second is a spinner and could use replacing.  You could try frustratingly to place a TCU in the horizontal between the second and third bolt, good luck!

Gear anchor 1"-3".  Descend north hard down climb or a short rap off a horn to the north 30'.

climbs.name: Acupuncture
climbs.fa: Earl Phillips, George Zelenz & Dean Rosnau, 12/86

content.description: This is an obvious south facing hand crack, its great and has great protection.  People that don't feel like waiting all day for Sail Away should think about jumping on this fun climb.
content.protection: Its sharp - consider taping your hands.  Cams from 1"-3", it's mostly hands.  Make an anchor out of 1-3" cams.  To descend, make a scary down climb off the north or sling an obvious horn to the north and rap about 30 feet.
